item.title: Half-Life: Alyx Fan Makes City 17 Scene Playable on Standalone Meta Quest 3
item.description:
Summary

  • Fan brought City 17 scene from Half-Life: Alyx to Meta Quest 3
  • Meta Quest 3 is capable of playing VR games wirelessly, with some limitations
  • Developer made Unity version of experience available for Quest 3 owners

A Half-Life: Alyx fan has done something really impressive, bringing the opening City 17 scene of the game to a standalone Meta Quest 3. While a Meta Quest 3 connected to a PC has been able to play Half-Life: Alyx from the get-go, it can't be used to play it all on its own.

The Meta Quest 3 is an impressive piece of technology, but it has its shortcomings. Due to it being a wireless, standalone device, it's not capable of playing some graphically advanced VR games unless it's connected to a PC that's doing the heavy lifting. However, that doesn't keep fans from pushing the device to the limit, as one has done now with Valve's VR hit.

A developer named Boris Novikov has done something few thought was possible and brought the opening City 17 scene to the Meta Quest 3. It wasn't a simple matter of just getting the game to work on the device without a PC, though. Instead, Novikov took Half-Life: Alyx 's assets, including sound, some physics interactions, and models, and put them into Unity. With the scene rebuilt, he then managed to get the opening running on the Meta Quest 3. A brief video demonstrates him walking through City 17 and interacting with objects. While there are some frame rate drops, at some points, the game ran with an FPS as high as 72.

Could The Meta Quest 3 Play Half-Life Alyx Without a PC?

The reason Novikov looked into this concept was because of how technology has progressed since the release of Half-Life: Alyx, as well as the original Oculus Quest. Novikov theorized that the XR2 Gen 2 chipset in the Quest 3 was powerful enough to handle the scene, and it seems his hunch was correct. Meanwhile, Valve is rumored to be releasing a new VR headset that will also function wirelessly, and will have a chip similar in capabilities to the Quest 3. It's possible that VR gamers could end up playing Half-Life: Alyx and similarly demanding VR games on purely wireless standalone devices in the near future.

There's good news for those who own a Quest 3 and want to try out the experience for themselves. Novikov has made the APK containing the Unity version of the experience available, so those who are familiar with installing custom APK can give it a try on their headsets. The link can be found in the YouTube demo video. Those with other Meta Quest devices, such as the Quest 2 or the Quest Pro are out of luck on this one, as those devices aren't as powerful as the Quest 3. However, given the Meta Quest 3S chipset and RAM are the same as the Meta Quest 3, it might work on that device. Regardless, this experiment demonstrates that the phone GPUs the Quest line has relied upon are becoming more capable all the time, and it could spell a strong future for VR.

item.title: Apex Legends Releases New Update for April 2025
item.description:
Summary

  • A new Apex Legends update made changes to the abilities of Ash, Mirage, Seer, and Conduit.
  • Weapon changes included buffs to the Hemlock and all SMGs, along with nerfs to the P2020 and L-Star.
  • The update aims to improve weapon and Legend balance to improve the overall battle royale experience.

Respawn Entertainment has rolled out a new update for Apex Legends , making notable changes to Legends and weapons. Apex Legends recently had its mid-season update for Season 24 on March 25, and the developer looks to keep the balance changes coming with this latest update.

The last few seasons of Apex Legends have featured significant changes to the battle royale experience. While a new Legend has not been added since Alter in Season 21, Respawn has made sweeping changes to various classes in the game. Most recently, the mid-season update for Season 24 of Apex Legends overhauled Skirmishers, providing them with some new perks to be more effective while playing highly mobile roles. Now, Respawn has revealed its latest round of balance changes.

As part of a new April update, Mirage, Ash, Seer, and Conduit have received tweaks to their abilities. Specifically, it now takes players longer to travel the maximum distance using Ash’s Phase Breach, increasing the time from 1.4 seconds to 2.5 seconds. Her minimum distance travel time with the Ultimate has also increased from 0.3 seconds to 0.5 seconds. As a result of this change, Ash players will take slightly longer to reposition using the Ultimate, giving other teams potentially more time to react.

While Ash received a slight nerf, Mirage gained a notable buff this time. Thanks to this patch, he deploys six decoys instead of five when using his Ultimate. In addition, Conduit's Tactical ability received an increase in health regen, with players gaining three instead of four shield per tick. Finally, Seer’s Tactical now takes 0.8 seconds instead of 1.4 seconds to hit targets, and his ability completes slightly faster, decreasing from 1.0 seconds to 0.9 seconds.

Beyond these Legend changes, Respawn has balanced some of the weapons in Apex Legends . Among the changes, the Hemlock received some buffs, with headshot damage increased by two and the magazine size increased by three for everything below the purple attachment. SMGs also got some attention, increasing headshot damage by one. While some guns were buffed, a few were nerfed by the developer. Specifically, P2020 damage decreased from 25 to 24, and the L-Star now has more substantial recoil and reduced projectile size. Along with these nerfs, Accelerated Weapons now have lower Ultimate gains, decreased from 30% to 20%.

It will be interesting to see how these changes impact the meta in Apex Legends moving forward. While the update does not contain massive changes compared to the mid-season update, it should help address some player complaints. However, time will tell if they have the desired effect on the battle royale experience in Apex Legends .

Apex Legends April 8 Update - Patch Notes

Ash:

  • Increased ultimate's max distance travel time from 1.4s -> 2.5s
  • Increased ultimate's minimum distance travel time from 0.3s -> 0.5s

Mirage:

  • Increased the number of decoys created during Mirage's ultimate from 5 -> 6

Conduit:

  • Increased tactical health regen per tick from 3 -> 4

Seer:

  • Decreased the time for Seer's tactical to hit targets from 1.4s -> 0.8s
  • Decreased the time for Seer's tactical to finish from 1.0s -> 0.9s

Weapons:

  • Increased Hemlok headshot damage by 2
  • Increased Hemlok magazine sizes by +3 for the base, white, and blue mags
  • Normalized the Volt hipfire to match other SMGs
  • Increased all SMG headshot damage by 1
  • Decreased P2020 damage from 25 -> 24
  • Increased the vertical and horizontal movement in the recoil pattern of the L-Star
  • Reduced the projectile size for the L-Star
  • Ult gained from knocks and assists with Accelerated Weapons has been reduced from 30% -> 20%
  • Fixed an issue where assists with Accelerated Weapons would sometimes not grant additional ult charge

item.title: World of Warcraft’s Epic of Shaohao Explained
item.description:
The Burdens of Shaohao is one of World of Warcraft ’s most treasured epics, depicting bravery, honesty, and wisdom. It explores the rich cultural beliefs of the pandaren and the history of their tranquil home. The lessons that Emperor Shaohao learned impact Azeroth to this day and provide a gentle lesson for all who come to venture into Pandaria.

Told in several parts, the Burdens of Shaohao is a story depicted in dynamic artwork, soulful music, and the detailed narration of a pandaren historian, Lorewalker Cho. Blizzard Entertainment originally released them to set the scene for Mists of Pandaria, and they remain to this day some of World of Warcraft ’s best works of art.

A Grave Fate Awaited Pandaria Long Ago

Ten millennia ago, Emperor Shaohao’s reign had only just begun, and he stood ready to inherit the majesty of the Pandaren Empire. However, when he consulted a jinyu soothsayer, he was told that a grave fate awaited his people. WoW fans know that around this time, the War of the Ancients was taking place. This was the Legion’s first invasion of Azeroth, and it took the combined might of dragon Aspects, Wild Gods, and mortals to fend them off. Even so, the Well of Eternity would collapse in on itself, splitting the continent apart in a catastrophe known as the Sundering.

Horrified to learn what the future for his realm held, Shaohao sought guidance. He needed to find a way to save his people from the wrath of the Sundering, so he ascended Pandaria’s mightiest mountain, Neverest. Gracefully swimming above the clouds was the Jade Serpent, Yu’lon, the spirit of wisdom. She told Shaohao he needed to seek out the heart of Pandaria, and that when he faced troubles, the land itself would teach him a way through.

Shaohao and WoW's Formidable Sha

The Sha of Doubt, and the Lesson of the Reed

Perplexed by her advice, Shaohao confided in his close friend, the Monkey King. But when the fierce winds of Pandaria suddenly swept his friend into the sky, Shaohao panicked. At that moment, the Sha of Doubt began to take form, twisting its way around the emperor and halting him in his tracks. As the wild storm battered his skin, Shaohao noticed the reeds beside him. Those that resisted the wind snapped in two, but those that bent with the gale instead persevered. Yu’lon was right, Shaohao realized. He understood the land’s lesson and stopped fighting his doubts, and the moment he let them go, the Sha dissipated.

The Spirit of Hope Against the Sha of Despair

Without apprehension, Shaohao set off after the Monkey King. When he arrived in the treacherous swamps of the Krasarang Wilds, he suddenly began to sink into the bog. The Sha of Despair was consuming him whole, sucking him deeper into the suffocating mud. He cried out for help, and heard a voice. It was another August Celestial, the spirit of hope. The Red Crane landed on the boughs of a great tree, showing Shaohao the way. The roots stretched deep into the ground, allowing it to rise high above the swamp. Shaohao found purchase on one of the roots below, and the emperor hauled himself free.

The Emperor of Pandaria Overcomes His Negative Emotions

The Black Ox and Shaohao's Fear

The next part of Shaohao’s journey would take him beyond the Serpent’s Spine Wall to a sha-infested land where the brutal and militant Mantid reside. Hesitant to enter, Shaohao caught sight of the Black Ox standing proudly among the wastes. The spirit of fortitude urged Shaohao to carry on, promising that he would find his way. Before long, the emperor discovered that the Monkey King was trapped by mantid warriors. Trembling with terror, he looked to nature as his guide once more. Shaohao saw the resplendent Kypari tree above, a plant infamous for its sticky sap. He overcame the Sha of Fear that had rooted him and struck the tree, raining globs of resin down on the Mantid to hold them fast. Finally, Shaohao had found his friend, and now he needed an army to stop the demonic invasion looming on the horizon.

The White Tiger Senses One Last Burden

High upon the frigid peaks of Kun Lai, an elite contingent of pandaren warriors trained day and night to protect the empire. Known as the Shado-Pan, they have long been famed for their skill and discipline. All were tutored by the White Tiger himself, the spirit of strength. At Shaohao’s arrival, the tiger knew exactly what the emperor wanted and why he should not have it. Shaohao’s confidence belied a fatal weakness, that of untempered emotion.

The White Tiger decided to test the young emperor. The August Celestial handed Shaohao a staff, challenging him to touch even one of his warriors. If he succeeded, the Shado-Pan would be his. As the tiger expected, Shaohao failed again and again, until finally, all his pent-up rage burst forth in the form of a Sha. The Sha of Anger raced towards the emperor, but before it could kill him, one Shado-Pan soldier gave himself up instead. That sacrifice taught Shaohao the meaning of true strength and that there are things worth giving one’s life for.

Shaohao and the Sundering That Shook the World

The sky darkened, the earth trembled, and all pandaren knew the end had come. They gathered in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms, filled with fear, rage, and despair. Shaohao realized that they needed to learn the lessons he had, but for that, they needed time. Pandaria had to survive the coming storm, and at last, he understood. The emperor was the true heart of Pandaria, and only he could save his people. Shaohao closed his eyes and gave his own life force to the land, shrouding it in a dense mist. As the rest of the world shattered in the Sundering, Pandaria was spared, floating free like a blossom in the breeze.

Just as Shaohao had intended, in the following generations, the pandaren came to shed the very same burdens he had. Their culture evolved into one mostly immune to the Sha, and they carried the lessons of Shaohao in their hearts forevermore. Pandaria remained hidden from the rest of the world, a land concealed by Shaohao’s breath to this day.

item.title: Rumor: Street Fighter 6 Leak Reveals Season 3 Characters
item.description:
Summary

  • A leaker predicts Sagat, Alex, C. Viper, and Ingrid for Street Fighter 6 Season 3, sparking mixed reactions from gamers.
  • Season 2 added Terry Bogard and Mai Shiranui, delighting fans. Elena is the last Season 2 character.
  • Players should approach leaks cautiously until Capcom confirms them.

A Street Fighter 6 leaker claims that Sagat, Alex, C. Viper, and Ingrid will be the Season 3 characters. Street Fighter 6 was released in 2023 and has since released two seasons, adding old acquaintances and new faces to the franchise's cast of playable fighters.

The first season of Street Fighter 6 saw Ed., Rashid, and Akuma returning as playable characters and the debut of A.K.I., a poison expert assassin and F.A.N.G. student. The following season, fighting game fans were in for a treat, as Street Fighter 6 added Terry Bogard and Mai Shiranui, M. Bison, and Elena from Street Fighter 3 , who's coming as the final Season 2 character. But while the beloved capoeirista has yet to return, a new claim brings potential news about what's next.

A user on the ResetEra forums called Patrick Balkaneil has claimed that Sagat, Alex, C. Viper, and Ingrid will be Street Fighter 6 Season 3 characters. According to them, although the list seems super random, it's what they've heard from industry colleagues. The revelation generated divided reactions among other users, with comments showing little excitement about the potential addition of Sagat and C. Viper. Others were indifferent about Alex's return and didn't object to Ingrid joining the roster. Another comment notes that this isn't the first time a Street Fighter 6 rumor has mentioned some of these names, possibly referring to Alex, C. Viper, and Sagat.

Who Are the Potential Street Fighter 6 Season 3 Characters?

  • Sagat
  • Alex
  • C. Viper
  • Ingrid

Sagat made an impact in his first appearance and has become a legend in Street Fighter lore. Remembered for the scar on his chest and the iconic eye patch, Sagat was one of Shadaloo's top enforcers. Alex is another series veteran, first seen in Street Fighter 3 , when the American joined the World Warrior Tournament after Gill seriously injured his best friend Tom. C. Viper debuted in Street Fighter 4 , with Capcom introducing the CIA undercover agent who fights using various gadgets to fight. Ingrid is the most obscure name on the list, who was first seen in Street Fighter Alpha 3 MAX . Little is known about the character, who uses mysterious energy and has a fighting style with ballet-based attacks.

As with other leaks, players should consider the information carefully, as it may change or even prove to be false until Cacpom makes an official announcement. While players wait for more news on Season 3, Street Fighter 6 is crossing over with Rival Schools , and preparing for the release of Elena as the final character of Season 2.

WHERE TO PLAY

Play legendary masters and new fan favorites like Ryu, Chun-Li, Luke, Jamie, Kimberly and more in this latest edition with each character featuring striking new redesigns and exhilarating cinematic specials.
Dominate the Fighting Ground: Street Fighter 6 offers a highly evolved combat system with three control types - Classic, Modern and Dynamic - allowing you to quickly play to your skill level.

The new Real Time Commentary Feature adds all the hype of a competitive match as well as easy-to-understand explanations about your gameplay. The Drive Gauge is a new system to manage your resources. Use it wisely in order to claim victory.

Explore the Streets in World Tour: Discover the meaning of strength in World Tour, an immersive, single-player story mode. Take your avatar and explore Metro City and beyond. Meet Masters who will take you under their wing and teach you their style and techniques.

Seek Rivals in the Battle Hub: The Battle Hub represents a core mode of Street Fighter 6 where players can gather and communicate, and become stronger together. Use the avatar you create in World Tour to check out cabinets on the Battle Hub floor and play against other players, or head over to the Game Center to enjoy some of Capcom's classic arcade games.

item.title: Best Indie Games That Let You Play Your Own Way
item.description:
Summary

  • RPGs like Undertale and Disco Elysium champion player agency through meaningful choices and deep customization.
  • Indie games like Griftlands and Kenshi emphasize player freedom and diverse gameplay through RPG elements.
  • Titles such as Battle Brothers and RimWorld offer various options for customization and strategy, providing players with control.

While there's certainly a well-deserved space for scripted, linear games, they don't typically afford players a great deal of agency. This won't be a deal-breaker for certain gamers, but those who enjoy making their own decisions and carving their own path may desire something more. That said, some linear games, such as Undertale , also manage to champion player agency.

These titles excel with their emergent gameplay and player freedom, emphasizing agency and creative thinking over clear direction and predetermined solutions. Be it meaningful choices in RPGs such as Undertale or the combat sandboxes of games like Battle Brothers , there's something here for all kinds of indie game fan.

8 Battle Brothers

A Sandbox RPG With Deep Customization

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Battle Brothers
Indie Games
Tactical
RPG
Strategy
Adventure
Systems
Released
April 27, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Battle Brothers tasks players with managing a mercenary company in a grim and violent low-fantasy world, frequently brushing up against death as they seek out and fulfill dangerous contracts. This indie game excels, however, with its RPG character progression, which allows for a great deal of customization.

With myriad perks, a variety of unique stats, and a plethora of gear to find and equip, each character in Battle Brothers can be specialized. As a result, players are able to develop their own strategy and play Battle Brothers in their own way. Furthermore, the game features a great variety of customization options before it even begins, allowing players to pick and choose the difficulty of combat, their starting funds, and even the end-game crisis they'll have to contend with.

7 Undertale

An RPG That Allows For Pacifism

Your comment has not been saved

Undertale
9.5 /10
Released
September 15, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood, Mild Language, Simulated Gambling, Use of Tobacco
Powered by

Undertale is a distinctive RPG that stands apart with its witty writing and unique world. While its charming characters may be the highlight of the journey, Undertale also excels with its unique combat, which affords players the choice of sparing or killing their foes.

This adds a great deal of emotional weight to each encounter, and the player's choices also have an effect on Undertale 's ending. As a result, Undertale is able to champion player agency while providing a memorable, linear adventure through a truly distinctive world.

6 Disco Elysium

An RPG Of Internal Choice & Struggle

Your comment has not been saved

Disco Elysium
9 /10
12
9.6 /10
Released
October 15, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs, Violence
Powered by

From the very start, Disco Elysium presents players with a great deal of choice. From character creation and progression to choosing how Harry, the game's protagonist, interacts and perceives the world around him, the player is very much a part of Disco Elysium 's storytelling.

While the bulk of choices come down to dialogue options, skills and items can also have an impact on the experience. And, although Disco Elysium borders on interactive fiction, its RPG systems provide enough agency for players to play in their own way.

5 Griftlands

A Diverse Deck-Building RPG

Your comment has not been saved

Griftlands
RPG
Indie Games
Adventure
Strategy
Systems
Released
July 11, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Griftlands is a roguelike deck-builder that, through RPG elements, allows players to have a say in how they interact with its world. This player agency results in an experience that's diverse, replayable, and tremendously distinct.

Griftlands features two distinctive combat systems: one for violent action and another for passive negotiation. The ability to approach many encounters without violence is particularly unique, but Griftlands integrates this into its gameplay by making negotiation a variation on combat. Since players have unique decks for both violence and negotiation, this added choice also deepens the deck-building aspect of the game.

4 Streets Of Rogue

Immersive-Sim Meets Action Roguelike

Your comment has not been saved

Streets of Rogue
Action RPG
Systems
Released
March 10, 2017
ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Matt Dabrowski

Powered by

Streets of Rogue is an action roguelite that stands out with its immersive-sim influences. Combining aspects of classic immersive-sims such as Deus Ex with the sandbox chaos of titles like Grand Theft Auto , Streets of Rogue takes a hands-off approach that encourages players to get creative and pursue objectives in their own way.

Streets of Rogue facilitates this gameplay via a systems-heavy design, offering dynamic factions and simulated citizens that roam each level with their own motivations. More important, however, is the abundance of unique items and myriad playable characters, each facilitating unique playstyles and multiple methods of approach.

3 RimWorld

A Colony-Sim With Diverse Options

Your comment has not been saved

RimWorld
8.7 /10
Released
October 17, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Use of Drugs, Violence
Powered by

RimWorld is an expressive colony-sim with a distinctive sci-fi western setting, standing out with its accessible take on Dwarf Fortress . While more accessible than the titan it takes influence from, RimWorld remains a deep management game with an abundance of ways to play.

Most notably, RimWorld features a variety of AI "storytellers" that control the pace of the game in unique ways. Players are able to choose their storyteller from the very start and, as a result, have a great deal of control over the experience. Once in the game, players are also tasked with constant decision-making, choosing how to develop and manage their burgeoning colony with little interference.

2 Kenshi

An Open-World Sandbox With No Set Goals

Your comment has not been saved

Kenshi
10 /10
Released
December 6, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
nr
Powered by

Kenshi , with its dynamic world and simulated denizens, gives little attention to the player. With such a hands-off approach to design, Kenshi is able to champion player agency above all else, tasking them with setting their own goals and pursuing them however they see fit.

Kenshi 's world lives and breathes with or without the player, with wandering mobs, diverse factions, and self-functioning settlements. This world asks nothing of the player, though it's often hostile. The RPG side of Kenshi , however, ensures that players have options and that they are always able to pick and choose something to focus on.

1 Caves Of Qud

A Deep & Detailed Character Creator

Your comment has not been saved

Caves Of Qud
Roguelike
RPG
Systems
Released
July 15, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

Caves of Qud is an open-world roguelike with an evocative science-fantasy setting and a deep, intricate set of RPG systems. The living, breathing nature of Qud is supported by a combination of hand-crafted and procedural content, allowing players to explore bespoke locations while enjoying a sense of discovery in the more random pockets of the world.

What really gives players agency over their experience, however, is the game's granular character creator. With its myriad options for mutations, cybernetics, statistics, and classes, Caves of Qud offers an abundance of ways for players to begin their journey. As a result, Qud is an RPG that encourages players to develop their character and play in their own way.
